<div class="section-label">Section · Setup</div>
<div class="section-title-strong">Getting started with the repository</div>

<p class="section-intro">
This section provides a minimal workflow to help you start using the Virtual Biophysical Lab
repository for learning, teaching, or early-stage research prototyping.
</p>

<ol>
  <li>
    Clone the repository locally or download it as a ZIP archive.
  </li>
  <li>
    Open the <code>notebooks/</code> or <code>rtm/</code> directories in your preferred IDE
    (e.g. RStudio, VS Code).
  </li>
  <li>
    Run one of the introductory scripts and modify key parameters such as LAI, chlorophyll
    content (Cab), or soil brightness.
  </li>
  <li>
    Visualise the outputs and compare results across scenarios, stress levels, or sensor
    configurations.
  </li>
</ol>



```bash
# Example: clone this repo
git clone https://github.com/CCGCAM/Virtual-Biophysical-Group.git
cd Virtual-Biophysical-Group
```
